Total_Links:
Global Sales:Totaled 351,174 units, representing a 1.7% decrease compared to May 2024.

Outside Korea:292,208 units were sold, a 0.9% decrease year-on-year.

Korean Market:Sales reached 58,966 units, a 5.2% decline compared to the previous year.

India:Domestic sales for May 2025 stood at 43,861 units, a 10.76% decrease compared to May 2024. Exports showed a positive trend, reaching 14,840 units, a 3.05% increase year-on-year, according to Times Drive. Total sales (domestic + exports) were 58,701 units, a 7.63% decrease year-on-year.

Hyundai Creta:Continued to be a strong performer in India, leading the company's sales charts with 14,860 units sold in May 2025.

Hyundai anticipates a recovery in demand for both domestic and international markets, citing reduced geopolitical uncertainty and an improved macroeconomic environment.

Key strategies include stabilizing domestic sales and boosting export growth.

Refreshed models, including the Hyundai Venue, are expected to drive consumer interest.

Hyundai is investing in advanced production technologies to keep pace with vehicle technical advancements. These include automated assembly, enhanced sensors, and real-time quality control.

Hyundai Motor Group is utilizing its private cloud, HCloud, in Equinix data centers globally to enhance services for connected car users.

The company is also developing a software ecosystem for Software-Defined Vehicles (SDV), according to the Hyundai Newsroom.

Hyundai Motor Group launched ZER01NE Fund III to invest in early-stage startups focused on future technologies.

Hyundai Motor is demonstrating its hydrogen mobility solutions and hydrogen society vision at the World Hydrogen Summit 2025.

Hyundai Motor India announced leadership changes to support global product alignment and manufacturing improvements in North America.

In May 2025, Hyundai Motor Company's operations were impacted by a routine, week-long maintenance shutdown at its Chennai manufacturing facility, affecting the availability of several key models .
